results.title: Body language in the classroom (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Aaron Wolfgang, International Telefilm Enterprises and Robert Wylam
results.brief_description: Encourages teachers to be aware of body language and shows how it can be applied in the classroom. Offers suggestions on nonverbal behavior for improving communication, including gesturing, pointing, increased eye contact, and other techniques.

results.title: Body invaders
results.creator_credit: Paula S. Apsell, Bonnie Waltch, Christine Z Wiser, WGBH (Boston) and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Cracking the code”.
Viruses and bacteria are able to change their genes rapidly, consequently beating and confusing the natural defenses within the bloodstream. If human knowledge can adapt to the task, theoretically AIDS could become a disease of the past.

results.title: Body defenses against the outside world
results.brief_description: Describes dangers in the environment and the body’s principal defenses against them; the skin, mucous membrane, bone structure, the five senses and the autonomic nervous system. Includes animated sequences. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Body defenses against disease. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and William Kay
results.brief_description: Examines the three lines of defence against infection - the skin and mucous membrane, the lymphatic system and the circulatory system including liver and spleen. Explains how the body becomes immune to certain diseases, and how to improve defences against infection.

results.title: Body defences against disease
results.brief_description: This film is an exposition of the human body’s three lines of defence against disease: the skin, the phagocytic cells and lymphatics, and the blood. Types of antibodies and their effect, the action of the liver and the spleen, and the application of a defence mechanism in specific cases are studied in detail. Immunology is also studies, and microphotography shows us phagocytosis.

results.title: Body care and grooming
results.brief_description: Made in 1947 to promote good grooming techniques for males and females. Shows boys and girls of senior high school taking care of their skin, hair, nails and teeth thus demonstrating habits which should form part of every ‘civilised’ person’s daily routine. Although the film has dated, it captures the styles and attitudes of the time.

results.title: Body and soul [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Richard Curson Smith, ABC-TV (Australia), BBC and Oxford Film and Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Australia: beyond the fatal shore [Widescreen]”.
Art critic Robert Hughes reflects on his relationship to Australia, 35 years after leaving the country. Contemplative after his near fatal car accident, Hughes reflects fondly on his childhood in Australia with an appreciation that only came from questioning his mortality. Episode one explores the concept of the pleasure seeking Aussie and whether there is more to us than our pursuit of leisure. Sydney’s annual Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras proves a focal point for the program which looks at beach culture, surf culture, the evolution of the wowser and the larrikin, censorship and homoeroticism in sport. Features interviews with Roy and H.G. (John Doyle and Greig Pickhaver), Dare Jennings and Bill Leeke. Includes footage of Norman Lindsay’s residence in the Blue Mountains, surf beaches on the East Coast, Old Sydney Town and an X-rated film shoot. Written and presented by Robert Hughes.

results.title: Bobwhite: through the year
results.creator_credit: Missouri Conservation Commission and Charles W. Schwartz
results.brief_description: Shows the quail’s dependence upon man’s use of the land, and the role of food, cover, weather, predation, and all other ecological factors have on the survival of the Bobwhite quail. Begins with the spring nesting season and follows the birds through summer, autumn, winter and back to spring. Beautifully photographed and great close-up shots of the quail as well as various other insects.
